attributes.comment:
As a family adopting internationally, I feel that these cost increases will cause a
financial strain to most adoptive families. Keep in mind that most international
adoptions can take up to two years to complete. Therefore, we have to do this
process twice. We have to pay twice. If you are going to up the fees, you need
to extend the fingerprint expiration time AND the I797C approval time to 2 years.

I can tell you waiting for the I797C approval from the Atlanta USCIS was the most
frustrating experience we have had in the adoption process. This office is slow
and inefficient compared to other USCIS offices. Why do some offices take only a
few weeks to process while the Atlanta office this past summer was ovre 15
weeks to wait.

Extend the length of fingerprints and I797C!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jennifer A. Zanieski
